title: "Omg you're such a meta sheep! You just copy the pros! I play what I want!"
body:
No, I don't copy the pros. And no, most people don't actually give a shit what you play as long as we can find a way as a team to make it work. 

But when you say you're going AD Heimer bot because you didn't get the role you wanted and you want to troll us - which lets be honest, this is the case the majority of the time - then expect to get reported. Youre getting reported for trolling because you didn't get your role and refused to communicate with the team when we asked you not to do that, not because we are meta sheep. 

We are trying to win, this is ranked. I'm going to let people basically play anything but if something odd is picked, I'm going to look that player up. If they main it or have success with it, have at it. But if you lose the majority of your games with it, I'm going to say something because again I'm trying to win. I'm not being a meta sheep when I don't want you playing AP Fiora top (and this is legit, I'm not making this one up). You have a 20% winrate with it, and it only works if your opponent is retarded. I'm going to ask you not to do it because I want to win. Play normal Fiora, shits broken. 

So in short, stop throwing this around because you want to troll or just "play what you want" despite it being terrible or you having terrible success with it. Play that shit in normals, don't play it in ranked.

If you replace a bruiser shen's triforce with shiv you have an effective working build that is neither troll nor useless (by bruiser I mean tanky with 1 or 2 offense items). Shen's options are pretty wide anyway for offense, most of the AS items can work on him. Zeph if you went tabi and still want cc reduction, Triforce/Shiv work similarly though Triforce can be the sole offense item but Shiv needs to be paired with something AD such as BoRK or Triforce. 

The catch is timing when you can afford to build it. If you are already falling behind, you cannot afford any damage because it will affect your main (damage soaking) role. But if you are even or maybe slightly ahead, with some careful play, you can tank to an extent without items (and thus be able to afford investing in damage). Or if you've already built some defense and are confident you are tanky enough for that stage of the game, go ahead and pick up that lightning sabre.
